result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M Cavanaugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Both Counts are Concurrent, with same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing to ensure abstinence

No Contact with any persons under age 18 unless they are family members or with PO approval.  Incidental contact while at work is acceptable
.

Upon successful completion of probation, and after an additional year with no further violations or trouble, the defendant may apply to the Court for 973.015.  A Hearing will be held to determine if the defendant is eligible for 973.015
.

Complete Sex Offender assessment and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
May be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Sanctions - to begin by this afternoon - no sentence credit toward jail sentence

On Each count Concurrent
.
Concurrent with: On both counts Concurrent
.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Sentence can be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Support Services

Unpaid Court financial obligations are converted to a Civil Judgment
.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: of Right to seek Postconviction Relief

10:52 am Def in court w/ Atty Gregg Earl Waterman.  Def in custody.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No victim response.  Kellis comments and asks the Court to go along with the recommendations.  He wasn't able to comply with basic conditions.  Waterman doesn't differ with the jail time.  I'd ask for em...  Cavanaugh comments.  Court comments.
SENTENCES:  7 mos CJ on each count - concurrent w/106 days credit.  It can be served on em.   The cc can be converted to a civil judgment.
Appeal rights advised.
Def may be released from jail on 6/16/15 for placement at Attic by PO. Remaining cond time reserved for Probation sanction as needed signed EML
from PO Barb Wuensch   re: Probation Review / recommendations

State by Skemp /  Def in custody w/o counsel / PO Barb Wuensch
CRT advises def of right to Atty
Wuensch spoke to Atty Geraldson - couldn't be here today
Def want to proceed w/o atty
CRT references letter from DOC - if bed opens up in ATTIC TLP, DOC will submit an Order
Def comments...
CRT comments on violation - TLP makes sense - hope you get in before 8-12-15.  But what you are suggesting is not enough
CRT:  DEF TO REMAIN IN CUSTODY  OF JAIL TO SERVE REMAINDER OF CONDITIONAL TIME WITHOUT RELEASE

ADDRESS INFO for Steven M Cavanaugh
Current: 4404 Markle Rd, #1, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States  (Effective: 06-03-2015)
Prior: 810 Redwood St., #44, Onalaska, WI 54650

State by Skemp /  Def in person w/ Atty Joseph Geraldson
Plea Quest & Waiver filed
State has complied w/ victim notification
Cts 1 & 2 - Def pleads NO CONTEST
CRT finds def's plea is F, V, & I made - factual basis exists to accept plea & CRT finds def guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 18 mos w/ conditions:  60 days CJ - may be served on EM w/ JSS - to begin by this afternoon, in both Cts Concurrent;  Complete Sex Offender assessment & comply w/ any trmt recommended;  No Contact w/ persons under age 18 unless they are family members or PO approves of it - incidental contact @ def's place of employment is acceptable;  No alcohol or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing to ensure abstinence;  Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed approp by the PO & follow-through w/ any trmt recommended;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  If def successsfully completes probation, and after 1 year w/ no violations, def may apply for 973.015 - Hrg needs to be held to determine if eligible for 973.015

Def w/Atty Beatty
$500 sig bond signed(15CM272 & 272) w/cond: no contact w/ ZMA, JKA or SH - refund cash
  Def pleads NG - NG pleas entered
PTCDA: 4/10 @ 2:30
STC: 4/30 @ 10 (EML)
